post_text: The Sherman Board of Education would like to thank our hard working teachers for their steadfast commitment to students and unwavering dedication to education during this unprecedented time. We are in this together, and we are proud to be in it with YOU!

post_text:
What an awesome display of spirit and community this afternoon as the Sherman School teachers, staff and administrators drove their cars all through town, cheerfully greeting students and families along the parade route. These days may be long and the weeks ahead will be difficult, but this school community is STRONG. Thank you, Sherman School!!!

And thanks to the Sherman Volunteer Fire Department for the escort!

post_text:
March 12, 2020

Dear Sherman School Families,

Although there are no known cases of coronavirus in our community, out of an abundance of caution, the Sherman School will be closed until further notice.

However, the school building will be open tomorrow, Friday, March 13th between the hours of 12:00 PM and 4:00 PM so that parents will be able to pick up hard copies of instructional packets (if they were not received today), Chromebooks, or any other personal items that students may wish to have.

Please also be sure to continue to check emails from the school as we plan to communicate regularly.

Thank you,

Jeff Melendez
Superintendent-Principal
melendezj@shermanschool.com
text:
March 12, 2020

Dear Sherman School Families,

Although there are no known cases of coronavirus in our community, out of an abundance of caution, the Sherman School will be closed until further notice.

However, the school building will be open tomorrow, Friday, March 13th between the hours of 12:00 PM and 4:00 PM so that parents will be able to pick up hard copies of instructional packets (if they were not received today), Chromebooks, or any other personal items that students may wish to have.

Please also be sure to continue to check emails from the school as we plan to communicate regularly.

Thank you,

Happy Sunday! Please remember to send questions/concerns to feedback@shermanschool.com. To-date, we have received just two emails regarding the conceptual design project. We'd love to answer your questions, but we need to hear from you in order to do so!

And don't forget - you can find all the reports, presentations and information about this work on the 'Conceptual-Design' tab on the Sherman School website.
http://www.shermanschool.com/conceptual-design

Thank you in advance for your participation and engagement in this important process!

post_text:
In an effort to respond to concerns, comments and questions that result from our ongoing study of the Sherman School building and grounds, we have created a document of FAQs. This document can be found on the Sherman School website here:

http://www.shermanschool.com/conceptual-design/frequently_asked_questions

This document will be updated regularly so please check back often. Also, if there are questions or concerns you have that are not addressed, please email us at feedback@shermanschool.com and we will gladly respond in our next update.

We thank you for your engagement in this process. Have a great week, neighbors!

post_text:
Dear Sherman School District Community,

The Sherman Board of Education will be holding public workshops for the 2019-2020 Budget in January and February. Budget workshops are scheduled as follows:

1/14/19 6:00pm- Staffing and Special Education
1/28/19 6:00pm - Technology, Security, Maintenance and Capital
2/11/19 6:00pm - Unfinished, High School Tuition & Transportation
2/25/19 6:00pm - Student Activity, Special Areas, Health Insurance & Other
2/26/19 6:00pm - If needed for modifications or as make-up date

Please note that these dates may be subject to change. Please check the school website (http://www.shermanschool.com/about_us/board_of_education/budget/2019-20_budget) for updates and the latest budget development documents and presentations.

The Board welcomes the engagement of the entire Sherman community as we develop a fiscally responsible budget that best serves the needs and aspirations of all Sherman students.

Respectfully,
Kasey Diotte, Board Chair
James Neunzig, Budget Chair

post_text: On Friday, November 9th, the Sherman School participated in the Sherman Veterans Association’s Veterans Day Ceremony. Our students performed the National Anthem, Amazing Grace, America the Beautiful, and Taps. Our eighth graders made a special video presentation and our fourth graders presented our Veterans with gifts. We were joined by our local Girl and Boy Scouts and our local and state elected officials. Pastor Bernie Powell of the Sherman Congregational Church offered the Invocation and Benediction. Local author John Cilio gave an incredibly insightful and educational keynote address. Special memory was conveyed upon Sherman School graduate Todd Lobraico and we honored the lifelong contributions of John O’Connor. We thank Ed Hayes and Monty Clark of the SVA for their leadership. The entire Sherman School community offers its greatest gratitude and respect to all our Nation’s Veterans for all they have done - and do - to ensure we live in the Land of the Free and the Home of the Brave.

We were joined by our local Girl and Boy Scouts and our local and state elected officials. Pastor Bernie Powell of the Sherman Congregational Church offered the Invocation and Benediction. Local author John Cilio gave an incredibly insightful and educational keynote address. Special memory was conveyed upon Sherman School graduate Todd Lobraico and we honored the lifelong contributions of John O’Connor. We thank Ed Hayes and Monty Clark of the SVA for their leadership. The entire Sherman School community offers its greatest gratitude and respect to all our Nation’s Veterans for all they have done - and do - to ensure we live in the Land of the Free and the Home of the Brave.

Due to a recent resignation, there is a vacancy on the Sherman Board of Education. Sherman residents interested in applying for this position are advised to send a letter of application to:
Nancy Winkler, Sherman BOE Clerk, 2 Route 37 East, Sherman, CT 06784. Or email at: winklern@shermanschool.com
Please be advised, applicants must be registered to vote. The term of office will be until January 1, 2020.

The Board thanks Rowland Hanley for his 7+ years of steadfast leadership and unwavering dedication to service and education in our district.

post_text: Each budget season, the BoE continues its efforts to reach out to the community through all means possible....Our friends at the RTC and the DTC (pictured) always offer us a welcome platform for discussing our budget and all the questions, concerns, and aspirations we share as a community about our School. Last night was no exception! We are all so fortunate to live in a Town where we work together to get great things done. And without fail, convening in-person always leads to a constructive exchange of diverse opinions and ideas where reason and collaboration prevail....Thanks everyone!

post_text: Sherman - nay, the world - needs more people like Tom Hackett. When a BOE member resigned in late 2016, the board selected Tom to fill the seat, primarily because of his extensive experience in facilities (Tom has been with the NM Building Dept for the last 20 years - leading it for last ten). In the 2017 election, Tom ran independently as an unaffiliated candidate and lost. But guess what? He decided to continue to serve and give of himself in support of the school. He acts as an “emeritus” member of our maintenance sub-committee, attending our meetings and offering the same expert counsel he provided as a board member. He stayed involved to see our AC project through approval and he’s a key collaborator in our facilities study initiative. Tom is just one example of the many good people in our Town who serve quietly and make significant contributions to making Sherman a better place. We thank him!

post_text:
At the Town Meeting Friday, December 1st, the BOE is seeking $130,000 to install Air Conditioning in the Sherman School Multi-Purpose Room. We feel this is an important, legitimate need and a responsible use of Sherman tax dollars. We made sure to return at least this amount back to the Town from last year's budget surplus in order to pay for this critical capital expense. The MPR is the center of so much of what we do - and what we hope to do - at the Sherman School as we expand programs in music, visual arts, performing arts, and other enrichment initiatives. It also houses sensitive equipment, instruments, and supplies.
And, let's face it: it gets damn hot in there!
The meeting is at 7PM at Mallory Town Hall.
We would appreciate your attendance and YES vote.
Thanks!!!

post_text:
We are thrilled to invite you to our very first Sherman School XP Expo for students in Grades 4-8. On Friday, December 1st, please join us between 8:30 and 10:00 am to tour exhibits and view presentations as students share their learning.
We look forward to welcoming you to The Sherman School as we showcase our amazing students and their accomplishments from the first trimester.
You don't need to be a parent to come see this wonderful example of how our talented faculty are breaking the mold on enrichment and learning and helping our students learn and grow in exciting new ways! All Shermanites are welcome!!!

post_text:
Welcome Back and Happy First Day of School!!!!
Thank you to everyone who worked tirelessly to make this day possible - and thank you to all Sherman residents for supporting our students!
They say it takes a village....well actually it takes an army of extremely dedicated and talented professionals, staff, volunteers, parents, elected officials, our SPTO, local businesses, community organizations and commissions, our veterans, our seniors, and all Sherman taxpayers...
And some pretty incredible kids!!

Thanks, have fun, and be good!

post_text: High School Students are Sherman Students Too!! As we wind down the year towards Sherman School awards and graduation, we would love to hear about how our High School students are doing! If you're a High School student, parent, relative, or friend, let us know about your academic and extra-curricular accomplishments and plans...We want to acknowledge and celebrate them at our meetings! boe@shermanschool.com
text: High School Students are Sherman Students Too!! As we wind down the year towards Sherman School awards and graduation, we would love to hear about how our High School students are doing! post_text:
"In the fifth grade, growing up in Dallas, I decided I wanted to go to MIT, get a degree in engineering, then go to Harvard Business School. Neither of my parents had gone to college, but I knew this was something I wanted to do. I liked to build things and I thought I’d like to build businesses, too. I read about MIT in the school library and it sounded real cool. Turned out it was."

Gene Hall
MIT & Harvard Graduate
CEO Gartner

SPTO Budget Presentation
text:
WED, APR 5, 2017
SPTO Budget Presentation

post_text: The Board will be providing an informal overview of our 2017-18 Budget at the normally scheduled SPTO meeting, Wednesday, April 5th at 8:30am. Hope to see you there....and be sure to support the SPTO!!
text: The Board will be providing an informal overview of our 2017-18 Budget at the normally scheduled SPTO meeting, Wednesday, April 5th at 8:30am. Hope to see you there....and be sure to support the SPTO!!

post_text:
It Takes a Village:
In an effort to better inform the greater Sherman community about our 2017-18 budget, the educational programs it supports, and its impact to taxpayers, the Board is working with several community groups to engage their members directly. We've offered to present an overview of the budget and answer questions.
We've included the Senior Center, Veteran's Organization, the RTC & DTC, local churches, the JCC, and - of course - the SPTO.
Not only are these conversations helpful for community members, but the Board often receives great insights and suggestions - even volunteers - from a segment of our Town we don't always reach easily or engage often enough.
We'll post updates to our calendar as dates and times are confirmed. In the mean time, keep a look out for these opportunities.
text:
It Takes a Village:
In an effort to better inform the greater Sherman community about our 2017-18 budget, the educational programs it supports, and its impact to taxpayers, the Board is working with several community groups to engage their members directly. We've offered to present an overview of the budget and answer questions.
We've included the Senior Center, Veteran's Organization, the RTC & DTC, local churches, the JCC, and - of course - the SPTO.
Not only are these conversations helpful for community members, but the Board often receives great insights and suggestions - even volunteers - from a segment of our Town we don't always reach easily or engage often enough.
We'll post updates to our calendar as dates and times are confirmed. In the mean time, keep a look out for these opportunities.

post_text: At the April 5th Board meeting, the Board has set aside as much time as needed during the second public comment period to take comments and answer questions on the 2017-18 budget. It would be very helpful if as many questions as possible were submitted in advance to Rowland Hanley (hanleyr@shermanschool.com), however questions will still be accepted the night of the meeting.
text: At the April 5th Board meeting, the Board has set aside as much time as needed during the second public comment period to take comments and answer questions on the 2017-18 budget. It would be very helpful if as many questions as possible were submitted in advance to Rowland Hanley (hanleyr@shermanschool.com), however questions will still be accepted the night of the meeting.

The Sherman Superintendent-Principal has announced a series of "coffees" that will provide an open forum where parents and guardians can meet with him and each other informally to ask questions, share ideas, make suggestions, seek advice, etc.
Coffees will take place at the Sherman School and last an hour. Come and go as you please. No RSVP necessary....

post_text:
The Sherman Board of Education has a current vacancy on the Board. All interested parties are invited to submit a request to be considered by the Board. It would be very helpful to submit a formal letter of interest explaining why you believe you would be an ideal addition to the board, along with a summary of your relevant professional and volunteer background. The Board will schedule interviews with all interested parties before rendering a decision.
Thanks!
text:
The Sherman Board of Education has a current vacancy on the Board. All interested parties are invited to submit a request to be considered by the Board. It would be very helpful to submit a formal letter of interest explaining why you believe you would be an ideal addition to the board, along with a summary of your relevant professional and volunteer background. The Board will schedule interviews with all interested parties before rendering a decision.
Thanks!
